i'm hakeem olusey i am an affiliated
professor of physics and astronomy at
george mason university and i sometimes
describe myself as a science mercenary i
go from field to field solving problems
but they typically have to do with the
universe in space but also develop
technologies that allow us to study the

world the basic building block of the

that the basic building block of the

packed tight with jellyfish right that's

volume and it's packed tight with

discovered but it turns out that there

john mitchell who had the idea that he
called dark stars prior to
einstein's general relativity and what
he surmised is that you could make a
star so big and increase the escape
velocity such that light couldn't escape
black holes are real
they exist we observe them all the time
in a variety of ways and not only do
they exist they shape the universe that
we live in they shape the evolution of
our galaxy and the evolution of the
universe as a whole the beautiful thing
about black holes is that they're such a
rich source of information we've learned
so much about the universe from studying
black holes space
time the very fundamental nature of
reality so it's called a black hole but
it's not a hole and it's not black it's
a volume of space where the escape
velocity exceeds the speed of light for
the entire duration of their lives black
holes grow we don't know what happens
inside the event horizon of a black hole
we can only speculate there's been no
observations but the event horizon is a
one-way valve
matter goes in light goes in
energy goes in
nothing comes out black hole evaporation
not withstanding the universe has to get
really really really old
for black hole evaporation to start
spitting stuff back out it's pretty much
a one-way trip these black holes are
like prisons our galaxy isn't only one
with a supermassive black hole as far as
we can tell every galaxy has a
supermassive black hole at its center if
i were to speculate is it possible that
our existence here on planet earth or
the existence of planet earth itself is
due to the supermassive black hole in
the center of our galaxy it's very
possible
if not likely so if someone asks you
